intro: Melochia parvifolia f. typica, commonly known as the small-leaved melochia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and showy, pale yellow to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
